intro: Terebinthus tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved terebinth, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Burseraceae, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its bark and resin have been used traditionally in various medicinal and aromatic applications. Terebinthus tenuifolia typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
